name: Current quality of theories
description: Theories are vague, verbal, and weakly predictive; they function more as rhetoric than precise explanatory systems.

name: Status of theory development
description: Theory construction is rare and undervalued; description is often mistaken for theorizing.

name: Derivation of testable hypotheses
description: Hypotheses are rarely deduced from (formal) theory.

name: How results inform theory
description: Findings rarely falsify or refine theory.

name: Lack of disambiguation
description: Constructs are undefined and boundary conditions are unclear.

name: Role of math, logic, and simulations
description: Formal modeling remains peripheral despite its value for explicating mechanisms and deriving testable predictions.

name: Division of labor
description: Lack of specializations for theoretical work vs. empirical research.

name: Overemphasis on methods
description: Methodological sophistication eclipses conceptual integration; flexible analyses are rewarded.

name: Measurement vs. substantive theory
description: Data models (factor, network) are mistaken for mechanisms.

name: Fragmentation across subfields
description: Incompatible constructs and vocabularies impede integration.

name: Lack of cumulative record-keeping
description: Few organized comparisons, versioning, and updating of theories.

name: Incentives favor discovery over understanding
description: Journals and funders reward empirical novelty and volume over theory development and conceptual integration.

name: Educational neglect
description: Curricula underweight theory formation, logic, and modeling.

name: Low replication rates
description: Vague theories can fit any data, false positives included, and there are too few good theories from which to derive hypotheses.

name: Lack of cumulative progress
description: Disconnected findings pile up without synthesis. Theories are not updated, and many overlapping theories survive or “fade away” too slowly.

name: Uninterpretable results
description: Ambiguous constructs and auxiliaries undermine inference.

name: Overproduction of isolated effects
description: A lack of integration and explanatory connections between effects under unifying theories.

name: Weak guidance for application & credibility
description: Imprecise theories offer limited leverage, do not allow the derivation of predictions, and undermine trust.
